meanings.definition: The deep or innermost part of something
meanings.sent1: In the ship's bowels, the treasure was hidden away.
meanings.sent2: The bowels of the forest held many secrets.
meanings.sent3: Exploring the bowels of the old castle revealed hidden passages.
meanings.sent4: The bowels of the earth contain precious minerals.
meanings.sent5: The bowels of the ocean hide mysterious creatures.

meanings.definition: The intestines, especially the lower part of the intestines
meanings.sent1: A healthy diet is essential for your bowels to function properly.
meanings.sent2: Digestive enzymes help break down food in the bowels.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food upset his bowels, causing discomfort.
meanings.sent4: The doctor examined her bowels to check for any issues.
meanings.sent5: Fiber-rich foods promote good health in the bowels.

meanings.definition: The seat of pity or the emotions
meanings.sent1: Her bowels were moved by the touching story.
meanings.sent2: Compassion from the bowels can lead to acts of kindness.
meanings.sent3: His bowels felt heavy with sorrow after the sad news.
meanings.sent4: The movie stirred her bowels, bringing tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: Empathy from the bowels can create strong connections between people.
